title: Butterflied leg of lamb with preserved lemons
description: This dish is a great for feeding a crowd. It is super simple to make and full of flavour.You can buy a butterflied joint from your butcher. A ‘butterflied’ joint is where the bone has been removed and the meat opened out into roughly the shape of a butterfly. This means it is quicker to cook and easier to carve.
ingredients: 2.5kg/5lb 8oz leg of lamb, butterflied and the skin scored
2 preserved lemons, finely chopped, pips discarded
salt and freshly ground black pepper
